detailed_results.query: How can I disable SMS notification from dashboard?
detailed_results.expected_answer:
For disabling SMS Notification you can follow below steps.
Go to settings tab & select user management.
Click on Action and select edit permission for whichever user you want to disable notification.
Uncheck the notification permission check box & click on save changes.
Now notification are disable for this users.
*Note: only admin or users who have user management permission can change permissions of other sub users.
detailed_results.generated_answer: To disable notifications for users, go to the settings tab and select user management [1]. Click on "Action" and select "edit permission" for the user you want to disable notifications for [1]. Uncheck the notification permission checkbox and click "save changes" [2]. Notifications will now be disabled for those users [2].

detailed_results.query: Why JioPay?
detailed_results.expected_answer: We are obsessed with technology and use it extensively to solve the payments needs of your business. Versatile Multiple feature launches, optimizations and improvements through the year to ensure you are always ahead of the curve Comprehensive Reduce your operational expenses using our fully managed platform that is designed for Security, Reliability and Scale Compliant JioPay meets the highest standards to meet compliance needs and reassure your decision to choose us Robust Our integration with multiple institutions ensures the best fail-safe to deliver superior success rates and uptime

JioPay is an effective and efficient platform to accept internet payments in India, with state-of-the-art infrastructure and risk and fraud engines [1]. As a JioPay Business partner, you have the opportunity to earn commissions and offer a digital payments experience for your customers [2]. The Checkout feature allows you to create custom checkout pages and increase retention [3].

detailed_results.query: What are the Salient Features of the Integrated Ombudsman Scheme 2021?
detailed_results.expected_answer: Salient Features of the Integrated Ombudsman Scheme 2021 1. It will no longer be necessary for a complainant to identify under which scheme he/she should file a complaint with the Ombudsman. 2. The Scheme defines 'deficiency in service' as the ground for filing a complaint, with a specified list of exclusions. Therefore, the complaints would no longer be rejected simply on account of “not covered under the grounds listed in the scheme”. 3. The Scheme has done away with the jurisdiction of each ombudsman office. 4. A Centralised Receipt and Processing Centre has been set up at RBI, Chandigarh for receipt and initial processing of physical and email complaints in any language. 5. The responsibility of representing the Regulated Entity and furnishing information in respect of complaints filed by customers against the Regulated Entity would be that of the Principal Nodal Officer in the rank of a General Manager in a Public Sector Bank or equivalent. 6. The Regulated Entity will not have the right to appeal in cases where an Award is issued by the ombudsman against it for not furnishing satisfactory and timely information/documents.
detailed_results.generated_answer:
The salient features of the Integrated Ombudsman Scheme 2021 are:

1.  Complainants no longer need to identify under which scheme to file a complaint with the Ombudsman [1].
2.  A 'deficiency in service' is the ground for filing a complaint, with a specified list of exclusions, meaning complaints will not be rejected for not being covered under listed grounds [1].
3.  The jurisdiction of each ombudsman office has been removed [1].
4.  A Centralised Receipt and Processing Centre has been set up at RBI, Chandigarh for the receipt and initial processing of physical and email complaints in any language [1].
5.  The Principal Nodal Officer, not below the rank of a General Manager in a Public Sector Bank or equivalent, is responsible for representing the Regulated Entity and furnishing information about complaints filed against them [1].

detailed_results.query: What is the goal of Jiopay ?
detailed_results.expected_answer: JioPay was created with the sole intention of creating a product that could revolutionize payments, facilitate quick and simple transactions without having a complex integration process for our users - the merchants of India. JioPay offers simple, self-service products for merchants and businesses of all sizes to accept payments online from their customers. JioPay products are tailor-made to the business needs of merchants in Bharat. With JioPay, merchants can accept payments from all digital modes including Cards of all types, UPI, Netbanking, Wallets and Bill Now, Pay Later among others
detailed_results.generated_answer: JioPay was created with the intention of creating a product that could revolutionize payments and facilitate quick and simple transactions without a complex integration process for merchants in India [1].

detailed_results.query: I am unable to login to the App/Dashboard. What can I do?
detailed_results.expected_answer: If you are unable to log in to the JioPay Business App or Dashboard, you can try the following: Check your internet connection: Ensure you have a stable internet connection by switching between Wi-Fi and mobile data. Reinstall the app: Uninstall the JioPay Business App and reinstall it to ensure you have the latest version. Verify your username and password: Double-check that you are entering the correct credentials. Use the 'Forgot Password' option if you need to reset your password. If the login issues persist, kindly contact merchant support at merchant.support@jiopay.in for further assistance.
detailed_results.generated_answer:
If you are unable to log in to the JioPay Business App/Dashboard, here are a few things you can try:

1.  **Check your internet connection:** Ensure you have a stable internet connection by switching between Wi-Fi and mobile data [1], [2].
2.  **Reinstall the app:** Uninstall the JioPay Business App and reinstall it to ensure you have the latest version [1], [2].
3.  **Verify your username and password:** Double-check that you are entering the correct credentials. Use the "Forgot Password" option if you need to reset your password [5]. If you have forgotten your password, select the 'Forgot password' option and follow the instructions indicated to reset the password [3].

detailed_results.query: What type of services and merchants are restricted?
detailed_results.expected_answer: • Adult Digital Content• Any merchant business model for products/services that are solely based on guaranteed“rebate”, “refund” or “prize” associated with the sale of those products/services (especially thosewhere the rebate or refund equals or exceeds the product/service purchase price or value).• Any merchant engaged in any illegal activity• Alcoholic beverages (beer, liquor, wine, champagne)• Any merchant selling products or services promising future guaranteed results in general• Anything promoting hate, violence, or intolerance• Pawn Shops• Deceptive and unfair Business Practices.• Collection Agencies engaged in the collection of uncollectible debt as defined by the Associations• Companies involved with chain letters of any type• Fortune Tellers/ Astrologers• Penny auction Merchants
detailed_results.generated_answer: Merchants and services restricted on JioPay include those involved in illegal activities [4], the sale of alcoholic beverages [4], and travel merchants without a National Travel Industry Bonding Organization license [3]. Additionally, businesses selling products or services promising future guaranteed results [1], those promoting hate, violence, or intolerance [1], and adult digital content [2] are restricted. Other restricted businesses include those with models based on guaranteed rebates or refunds that equal or exceed the purchase price [2], collection agencies engaged in the collection of uncollectible debt [5], companies involved with chain letters [5], and those that trade in animals [3].
